workflow.name: Create Stripe invoices from Airtable orders with Google Sheets logging
workflow.description:
## Description
Automate B2B order invoicing by fetching orders from Airtable, validating paid B2B entries, creating Stripe customers and invoices, finalizing invoices, and logging structured invoice data into Google Sheets. This workflow ensures seamless B2B billing, centralized record-keeping, and reduces manual errors in financial operations. ‚ö°üí≥üìä

## What This Template Does
- Triggers hourly to check for new B2B orders. ‚è±Ô∏è
- Fetches order data from Airtable (Orders table). üì•
- Filters only paid orders with ‚ÄúB2B‚Äù tag. ‚úÖ
- Creates a corresponding Stripe customer from order details. üë§
- Processes order line items for invoicing. üì¶
- Creates a Stripe invoice with due date and payment terms. üßæ
- Finalizes the invoice automatically. ‚úîÔ∏è
- Formats invoice details (totals, due dates, customer info, links). üîÑ
- Logs structured invoice data into Google Sheets for tracking. üìä

## Key Benefits
- Fully automates B2B invoicing workflow from orders to finalized invoices. üîÑ
- Ensures all invoices are linked, structured, and logged in Sheets. üßæ
- Reduces manual effort and eliminates data entry errors. ‚ö°
- Maintains centralized invoice tracking for finance teams. üìÇ
- Creates a consistent billing flow integrated with Stripe. üí≥

## Features
- Hourly Trigger ‚Äì Continuously monitors Airtable for new/updated orders.
- Airtable Integration ‚Äì Fetches order details automatically.
- Conditional Filter ‚Äì Processes only ‚ÄúB2B‚Äù paid orders.
- Stripe Customer Creation ‚Äì Automatically creates customers in Stripe.
- Line Item Processor ‚Äì Handles Shopify/Order line items or test data.
- Stripe Invoice Creation ‚Äì Generates draft invoices with due dates.
- Invoice Finalization ‚Äì Auto-finalizes and prepares invoices for payment.
- Data Formatter ‚Äì Structures invoice info (totals, links, dates, status).
- Google Sheets Integration ‚Äì Logs all invoice data for reporting.

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Airtable Personal Access Token with read access to Orders table.
- Stripe API credentials with customer + invoice permissions.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with read/write access.

## Target Audience
- Finance/ops teams handling B2B customer invoicing. üíº
- SaaS or eCommerce businesses with B2B order flows. üõçÔ∏è
- Startups needing automated billing + centralized reporting. üöÄ
- Teams tracking Stripe invoices inside Google Sheets. üìä

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect Airtable credentials and replace with your base/table IDs. üîë
- Configure Stripe API credentials for invoice + customer creation. üí≥
- Link Google Sheets credentials and update the target sheet ID. üìä
- Adjust order filtering conditions (tags, payment status) as needed. ‚öôÔ∏è
- Test with sample data to validate invoices are created + logged. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Airtable Order to Stripe Invoice (B2B/Manual Capture)

parameters.content:
## üöÄ B2B Invoice Automation Workflow

This workflow automatically creates Stripe invoices for B2B paid orders and logs them to Google Sheets.

### What it does:
- Triggers every hour to check for new B2B orders
- Filters for paid B2B orders only
- Creates Stripe customers and invoices
- Logs invoice data to Google Sheets for tracking

### Requirements:
- Airtable with Orders table
- Stripe account with API access
- Google Sheets for logging

### Setup Instructions:
1. Configure your Airtable credentials
2. Set up Stripe API credentials
3. Connect Google Sheets with proper permissions
4. Update the record ID in "Fetch B2B Order" node
5. Update Google Sheets document ID

## ‚è∞ Schedule Setup

**Purpose:** Triggers the workflow every hour to check for new orders

**Configuration:**
- Interval: 1 hour
- Can be changed based on your needs

**Tips:**
- For testing, use manual trigger first
- Consider timezone settings for your business hours

## üìã Airtable Setup

**Purpose:** Fetch order data from your Airtable

**Required Steps:**
1. Replace the hardcoded record ID with your actual record ID
2. Update base ID and table ID to match your setup
3. Ensure your Airtable has these fields:
   - Customer Name
   - Email
   - Phone Number
   - financial_status
   - tags

**Security:** Never commit your actual record IDs to public repos

## üîç Order Filtering

**Purpose:** Only process B2B orders that are already paid

**Filter Conditions:**
- financial_status = "paid"
- tags contains "B2B"
- Both conditions must be true (AND logic)

**Customization:**
- Modify conditions based on your order structure
- Add additional filters if needed

## üë§ Stripe Customer Creation

**Purpose:** Create or update customer in Stripe

**Configuration:**
- Maps customer data from Airtable
- Uses continueOnFail to handle existing customers
- Stores customer ID for invoice creation

**Required Fields:**
- Customer Name
- Email
- Phone Number (optional)

**Note:** Stripe will return existing customer if email already exists

## üìÑ Line Item Processing

**Purpose:** Split orders into individual line items for invoicing

**What it does:**
- Processes each product in the order separately
- Formats data for Stripe invoice creation
- Handles missing data gracefully
- Creates test data if no order items found

**Output:** One item per product for detailed invoicing

## üßæ Invoice Creation

**Purpose:** Create draft invoice in Stripe

**Configuration:**
- Creates invoice for the customer
- Sets 30-day payment terms
- Uses send_invoice collection method
- Includes all pending invoice items

**Parameters:**
- customer: Stripe customer ID
- currency: Order currency
- days_until_due: 30 days
- auto_advance: false (manual finalization)

## ‚úÖ Invoice Finalization

**Purpose:** Finalize the draft invoice to make it payable

**What happens:**
- Converts draft to final invoice
- Generates invoice number
- Makes invoice payable by customer
- Triggers email sending (if configured)

**Parameters:**
- auto_advance: true (automatically send)
- Invoice ID from previous step

## üìä Data Formatting

**Purpose:** Format invoice data for Google Sheets logging

**Data includes:**
- Invoice details (ID, number, status)
- Customer information
- Financial amounts (converted from cents)
- Important URLs (hosted invoice, PDF)
- Timestamps for tracking

**Output:** Clean, formatted data ready for spreadsheet

## üìã Google Sheets Logging

**Purpose:** Log invoice data to spreadsheet for tracking

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace YOUR_SPREADSHEET_ID with your actual Google Sheets ID
2. Ensure proper column headers in your sheet
3. Grant n8n access to your Google account

**Logged Data:**
- Invoice details, customer info, financial amounts
- URLs for invoice access
- Timestamps for tracking

**Security:** Never commit your actual spreadsheet ID to public repos

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
